definitions.definition: The reciprocal succession of (normally two) things in time or place; the act of following and being followed by turns; alternate succession, performance, or occurrence
examples: the alternation of day and night
alternation between night shifts and day shifts
alternation of feelings between hope and fear

definitions.definition: The response of the congregation speaking alternately with the minister .
A pattern by which more than one construct is possible, as with "Alice cooked Bob dinner" and "Alice cooked dinner for Bob".
A sequence that alternates between positive and negative values.
A construct in a regular expression that can match any of several specified subexpressions .
A type of partial truncation of a polygon , polyhedron or tiling in which alternate vertices are removed.

main_definition: The reciprocal succession of (normally two) things in time or place; the act of following and being followed by turns; alternate succession, performance, or occurrence
secondary_definitions: ( religion ) The response of the congregation speaking alternately with the minister .
( linguistics ) A pattern by which more than one construct is possible, as with "Alice cooked Bob dinner" and "Alice cooked dinner for Bob".
( logic ) The " inclusive or " truth function .
( mathematics ) A sequence that alternates between positive and negative values.
( computing ) A construct in a regular expression that can match any of several specified subexpressions .
( geometry ) A type of partial truncation of a polygon , polyhedron or tiling in which alternate vertices are removed.
